intro: Tupa montana, commonly known as the mountain tupa, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often blooming in the summer months. Tupa montana thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important species in its native habitat.
